question: An enemy fighter jet is flying along the curve given by <katex>$y=x^{2}+2$</katex>. A solider is placed at (3,2) wants to shoot down the jet when it is nearest to him. Then the nearest distance is
explanation: Minimize distance squared <katex>$D^2 = (x-3)^2 + (y-2)^2$</katex> subject to <katex>$y = x^2+2$</katex>.
Derivative <katex>$4x^3 + 2x - 6 = 0$</katex>. By inspection, <katex>$x=1$</katex> is a root (<katex>$4+2-6=0$</katex>).
